Funded by the Cooperation and Development Agency of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Italy.p

section.para: In June 2015, a DHIS2 Health Information System was set up to assist the Kurdish health authorities in collecting population data and improving the access and quality of public health care.

A KRG DHIS2 pilot project led by the University of Tor Vergata, Rome, and realized by IPRO and Euresist was deployed across a set of pilot health centers and hospitals in the Kurdish directorates of Erbil, Duhok and Slemani.

With 34 operating users spread across 10 health centers, Kurdish medical professionals can now follow more than 130,000 health events. Health professionals are gathering statistics for disease diagnoses, hospital discharges, registrations of births, deaths and immunizations.
